entries.noEntries: No log entries yet. Start streaming to see logs.
entries.noEntriesStreaming: Listening for logs... (tip: increase log levels to see more activity)

gologLevel.title: Log Level Configuration
gologLevel.description: Choose what gets logged and how much detail to show. Start with a base level like 'error' to see only problems, or add specific components to track (like 'error,nat=debug' to debug UPnP issues). Same syntax as GOLOG_LOG_LEVEL. <0>Learn more</0>
gologLevel.invalidSubsystemLevel: Subsystem "{subsystem}" must be followed by an equal sign and a log level.

autocomplete.invalidSubsystem: Subsystem "{subsystem}" is not valid. Valid subsystems: {subsystems}
autocomplete.invalidLevel: "{level}" is not a valid log level. Valid levels: debug, info, warn, error, dpanic, panic, fatal

debugGlobal.title: Enable Debug Logging Globally?
debugGlobal.message: You are about to enable DEBUG level logging for all subsystems. This will generate a very high volume of logs and may impact browser performance.
debugGlobal.detail1: Debug logs can generate 100+ messages per second
debugGlobal.detail2: High CPU usage and memory consumption
debugGlobal.detail3: Potential browser tab crashes or freezing
debugGlobal.suggestion1: Consider enabling debug logs for specific subsystems only
debugGlobal.suggestion2: Use for short debugging sessions (< 5 minutes)
debugGlobal.suggestion3: Monitor the log rate indicator and disable if needed

highRate.title: High Log Rate Detected
highRate.message: Current log rate is {rate} logs/second, which may cause performance issues.
highRate.detail1: High log rates can slow down the browser
highRate.suggestion1: Consider reducing log levels for busy subsystems
highRate.suggestion2: Use buffer configuration to limit memory usage

autoDisable.title: Log Streaming Auto-Disabled
autoDisable.message: Log streaming was automatically disabled due to extremely high rate ({rate} logs/sec).
autoDisable.detail1: This protects your browser from potential crashes
autoDisable.detail2: Logs are still being cached in persistent storage
autoDisable.suggestion1: Reduce log levels before re-enabling streaming
autoDisable.suggestion2: Check subsystem log levels and disable debug mode

unsupported.title: Unsupported Kubo Version
unsupported.description: Your current version of Kubo ({version}) does not support the log level management feature required for this diagnostics page.
unsupported.upgradeDescription: To use the log level management features, you need to upgrade to a newer version of Kubo that supports getting log levels and tailing logs from the RPC API endpoint.

dhtProvide.title: DHT Provide
dhtProvide.description: Trigger a background provide operation for a CID. This will announce the CID on the DHT so other peers can discover providers for it.

screen.description: Visual summary of DHT provide stats. See <0>configuration guide</0> and <1>metric reference</1> for details.
screen.notEnabled: DHT Sweep provider is not enabled on this node.
screen.workersWarning: Workers at {percent}% capacity. If the queue grows, consider increasing Provide.DHT.MaxWorkers (current: {max}).

connectivity.title: Connectivity
connectivity.tooltip: Overall health of the DHT provide subsystem: connectivity, uptime, and keyspace coverage.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.tooltip: The reprovide cycle is the periodic sweep that reprovisions groups of CIDs to the DHT.

queues.title: Queues
queues.tooltip: Pending items in the provide and reprovide queues.

operations.title: Operations
operations.tooltip: In-flight provide and reprovide operations, throughput rates, and cumulative statistics.

workers.title: Workers
workers.tooltip: Breakdown of worker status by type: periodic workers handle scheduled reprovides, burst workers handle initial provides.

network.title: Network
network.tooltip: DHT network metrics: peer counts, reachability, record holders, and success rates.
